page.title: 01URRA AND INGLEBY FARMS
page.content: Panoramic views across the valley south of Ingleby Greenhow reward motorists and wlkers after a long pull up Clay Bank. In the Forestry Commission car park people gaze out at the patchwork of fields. Majestic trees fall away beneath them and climb up behind them to Hasty Bank, part of the Cleveland Way. In the permanent shadow of the crescent-shaped of Greenhow and Battersby Plantations, farms thrive. The ICI's Outdoor Centre nestles into the hillside, well off the beaten track. The main Stokesley to Helmsley road bustles through the area. Just a hop away the tiny hamlet of Urra dozes, seemingly years behind in pace and progress. Old stone farmhouses cling to hillsides which rise steeply to the bracken-clad Urra Moor. Besides the pretty winding Nilsdale Beck, sheep munch lush grass
